data.message:
I'm working right now in a single page app that returns issues in sensors and generating reports. our database table has over 17 Billion record (Redshift) and we depend on another Sales Force Database for The Issues. 

Reports i don't wanna tell you how is it but it's a huge project and we are managing it in a single page app :)
it requires a lot of attentions to small details. on-going-code refactoring. planing everything single detail before even writing a single line of code.
specs must be 100% maintained so incase an issue happen in any of your module you can return to the documentation and see what's going on.
Managing large apps is a serious challenge in SPAs. It's not mature enough for best practices to emerge but there are obvious patterns like clientside routing and modularisation.
And you don't create SPA because it's easy, you create it because the user experience makes sense in a particular scenario.

I hate the word SPA :D I built single page applications using Angular.JS - Backbone.js - Ext JS ... It's a great experience and it requires collaboration between developers on both the client side and the server side.
